FOUND IN: Elbe - An important European river originating from Germany's western mountains and emptying into the North Sea.
Antislavery - Opposition against the practice of slavery, often referring to historical movements for emancipation.
Sheikh - An Arabic term for an elder or leader of tribal groups; it's also used by some regional leaders.
Quilting (involves stitching pieces together but also uses various types of sewing techniques)
Fjord (deep, narrow body of water with steep cliffs on either side, often formed by the retreat of glaciers)
Mound - A rounded pile or heap, often naturally occurring in earth formations like hills or mountains.
Sage - Has slightly wrinkled, silvery-green leaves with a soft texture.
Acres - The plural form of acre and used in measuring large plots of land.
Samosa - Deep-fried or baked triangular pastry filled with savory ingredients such as potatoes, peas, and spices.
Sarum ruffle (relating to the Sarum use of cowls in England)

CLUE: King Richard 1st had nickname like Latin hero
Small African nocturnal primate with large eyes
